intro: Pavetta macrantha, commonly known as the large-flowered pavetta, is a shrub native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves that are usually glossy and dark green. Its showy, tubular flowers are typically pink or white, with five petals and prominent stamens. Pavetta macrantha thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories or along stream banks.
